name: uncreative
content:

not producing or using original or unusual ideas: Housework is generally uncreative, except for cooking, of course.
More examplesFewer examplesToy cars also demonstrate whether imaginative play can develop or whether the child is showing repetitive and uncreative play pushing the car backwards and forwards on the same spot.Financial control is seen by many as boring, bureaucratic and uncreative. The company is full of nice but rather uncreative people.The unions are as traditional, narrow-minded and uncreative in their approach to educational debate as the Government.
